captions.text: [MUSIC PLAYING]
-Hey guys.
It's Brooklyn and Bailey.

And today we're going to
be showing you guys how
to make two Easter treat/gifts.
It's kind of both.
-Yeah.

-And we're excited to
show you guys these.
They are super delicious.
-And super cute.
-So let's get started.

So our first gift is
going to be like a carrot.
And you need all of these.

These are all of
your ingredients.
-I guess you could say.
-Anyways.

Our first one is cheese
balls/cheese puffs,
whatever you like to call them.

The next ingredient
is the frosting bags.
And they look like this.
-Kind of like a triangle shape.

-And our last thing is
this green curly string
for curling ribbon.

You know the little
string that's
on the bottom of a balloon?
That's what it is.

And then last but
no least, scissors.

Your first step,
you're going to want
to take your decorating bag.

And if you would
hold this for me.
-Of course.
I'll be the model holding it.

-And then you're gonna want to
take your cheese puff-- cheese
balls.
Either one.

And you're gonna want
to dump it into--

-We're gonna try to do
this without spilling,
which might be a difficult task.
-OK.
Ready?
-Go.
-Is it open all the way?
-Yeah.
It's open all the way.
-Here, open the--
-OK.
Got it.
Oops, spills.
Whoo!

-Gonna need to pour
some of those back in.
OK.

And once that's done, you're
going to take the top like so

and get your little balloon
ribbon, or your curling ribbon.
Will you hold this for me?
And you will tie the top.
You can tie it in a knot.
You can tie it in a bow.
Either/or.
I'm gonna tie mine in a knot.
And then tying it in a knot.

And then I'm gonna take the
ends and I'm going to curl them.
OK.
-There we are.
-There we go.
Uncooperative ribbons.
-There we go!
Now we got a good one!
-OK.
Let's try this one again.
No, no, wait.
OK.
Oh my.
Curl.
-There it's better.

-Gonna curl the ribbon,
and there you go.
You have your Easter carrot.

-Our next carrot, I
guess you could say,

is going to be made
out of sugar cones.
And these were from Wal-Mart.

But you could basically
find them anywhere.
They're just plain sugar cones.

And then we're also
going to be using

another one of our
disposable icing bags.

And then we also
have this ribbon.
It's just pink polka dotted.

You can basically use
whatever ribbon you want to.

And again, we got all
of this from Wal-Mart.

And last but not least,
we have our peanut M&Ms.

And they're Easter
colors, but again,

it doesn't matter
what color they are.

You can use whatever
kind you want to.
And then, scissors.

So to start, I'm going
to take my icing bag.

And then I'm going to take
one of my ice cream cones

and put it in so it is
filling the bottom of the bag.
See that?

Then I'm going to
have you hold this.

And then I'm going to take
my M&M bag and pour the M&Ms

in so they reach about the
top of the ice cream cone.

And then you're going to want
to pour a little bit more

so it's about two to three
inches of M&Ms folding over

at the top of the
ice cream cone.
So, here we go.
Pour these in there.
That's about where we want it.

After you've filled your
ice cream cone with M&Ms,

I'm going to take my ribbon
and tie it around the top.
Let's tie this on there.
-Tie it in a cute little bow.
-Yeah.

And if you don't want to
fill it as high as needed,

you can always stuff the
cone with tissue paper,

or you would like, pour
in a little bit less M&Ms.
It's totally up to you.

And there you have your
adorable spring carrot.

-I actually thought
at first that it

was an ice cream
cone, not a carrot.

It looks kind of more like an
ice cream cone, don't ya think?
-Yeah.
I can see that.
Yeah.

-I think it's probably supposed
to kind of look like a carrot

to bring in the Easter theme,
but then it kind of looks

like an ice cream cone,
because ice cream cones are

kind of like summer,
springy thing.

You can finally eat ice cream
cones cause it's warm outside.

-I still think it
looks like a carrot.
-I think it's an ice cream cone.
You decide!

-Thank you guys so much
for watching this video.

Be sure to follow us on
Twitter @BrookandBailey.

-Also, don't forget
to leave a comment

below on which carrot/ice
cream cone is your favorite.

And we will see
you guys next week.
Bye.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
-News.

And we are so glad we had
the opportunity to do that.

And there is also
a comment section.

If you click on the link
and watch the video,

you can say like, hey,
Brooklyn and Bailey sent us.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

-You're going to take your
cheese puffs/cheese balls.

I don't really know what
you want to call them.

You want to take this huge
thing and just pour it in.

-And we're going to try and
do this without spilling.
Go ahead.
-Hold on.
-Got it.
OK, go.

-And you're going to want
to just like keep-- wha!
